Transcript:
Livvie: Where did you come from? I wasn't dancing with you. I 
was -- I was dancing with --
Rafe: Who? Who, Livvie? Who did you think it was?
Livvie: God, that feeling.
Alison: Sorry -- what's going on here?

Joshua: I'm Joshua Temple. I'm sorry for the confusion. I manage 
the band. It seems like everyone confuses me for someone else.
Rafe: I guess we both thought you were someone else.
Joshua: Who might that be?
[Woman laughs]
Elizabeth: Oh. I don't usually do this.
Stephen: You're doing just fine.

Lucy: Somebody help us! Ok. Help! Please. You're going to be 
fine. You're going to be ok! Somebody please help! Someone -- oh, god. You're 
bleeding so much. You have to stop bleeding!
[Ian groans]
Ian: They got me good this time.
Lucy: Am I -- am I hurting you?
Ian: No. pressure's good, helps the bleeding.

Lucy: Ok. Oh, wait, your phone. I'll get the phone. I'm going to 
call the hospital. Oh, you're going to be ok. Oh! Hello, this is Lucy Coe 
Collins! I'm at the Ramsey house at the mouth of the river! Dr. Thornhart has 
been stabbed! I need an ambulance right away!
Jack: Lucy.
Lucy: Oh, God, Jack!
Jack: Ok.
Lucy: He's going to be ok. You're going to be ok.
Ian: Oh, you're such an optimist.

Lucy: Help's on the way. I promise you, I swear, you're going to 
make it through this. I swear!
Ian: I don't think so. Not this time.
[Captioning made possible by ABC, inc., And Soapnet]

Rafe: Well, whoever I thought it was under this mask, either I 
was wrong or he's long gone.
Joshua: Are you going to be all right?
Alison: Oh, yeah, she's always like this.
Livvie: Yeah, I'm fine.

Joshua: You should tell your friends to lighten up. It's only 
rock 'n' roll, but you'll like it. Enjoy the party, kids.

Alison: Ok, I'm confused. Can somebody please tell me what's 
going on here?
Rafe: Tell her, Livvie.
Livvie: I don't know.

Rafe: Tell here what you were feeling. You sensed something, 
just like I did.
Livvie: I don't know what you're talking about.
Rafe: You said you thought --
Livvie: Rafe, I don't know what you're talking about!
Rafe: Who did you think it was?

Livvie: I only came here to find you and tell you to get rid of 
her.
Rafe: Who? What are you talking about?

Livvie: Tess! That -- that gross, mute bundle of goodness who 
lives in the forest and happens to look exactly like me. What, is she your 
version of a Grimm's fairy tale?

Alison: No, I wish you had made it up. Look at how upset it 
makes her.

Livvie: Don't play me for stupid. It was no accident. I know you 
sprinkled your little fairy magic dust and created her to destroy whatever is 
left of my life.

Rafe: Ok. I told you, I have no more angel dust, I have no more 
magic powers. But you know what? If I did have the power to create another 
person, I wouldn't waste it creating another you!

Livvie: Oh, Rafe, don't lie to me! I know you want to destroy 
me. I know it. And you should see him with her. He thinks that she is just as 
cute as a bucket of puppies! It makes me sick!

Rafe: All right, just give it up, ok? I do not want to destroy 
you. But you know what, someone else might want to.
Livvie: What's that supposed to mean?

Rafe: What were you feeling when you were dancing with that man, 
huh? At were you thinking? Come on, Livvie, just tell me.
Livvie: No, you know what, I don't have to tell you anything.
Rafe: Tell me. Tell me. Livvie? Livvie?

Alison: No, leave her alone! It's not worth the time! What is 
going on, please?

Rafe: Don't you think I would tell you if I knew? I'm sorry. I'm 
sorry. It's just Livvie and that -- that man, the man standing there in the 
mask, dancing with her.
Alison: What, are you talking about Joshua?

Rafe: Yes, I’m -- well, no. I don't know, I mean, I -- it felt 
like i knew him. It felt like -- it felt like i fought him before or something, 
but then i took his mask off and it just wasn't what i expected.
Alison: Rafe, I'm sorry, I don't --

Rafe: I just -- I wish i had my powers back for one day just so 
I'd know for sure.

Alison: No, no, no, don't -- don't you even say that. I don't 
want you to wish it, I don't want you to think it. Because that means that I 
would lose you all over again, and that terrifies me.

Lucy: Go to the road! Make sure the ambulance knows where we 
are. Make sure they find us. Hurry up.

Jack: All right, be right back. Stay here with Lucy. I'll be 
right back, ok?

Lucy: Ian, no, listen to me -- Ian, look at me. Look at me now, 
please.
Ian: Danny.
Lucy: Yes, Danny. You have to focus on your little boy.
Ian: He needs you.
Lucy: No.
Ian: Yeah.

Lucy: No, he doesn't. He needs you. You're his father and you 
need to be with him. Oh, Ian Thornhart, you are the most stubborn, mule-headed 
man I've ever met in my life, and you are not ever giving up on anything, 
especially now!
[Ian groans]

Lucy: Listen to me -- no! I'm so sorry you're hurting, but for 
God's sakes, hang on for Danny!
Ian: Promise you'll take care of him, ok?

Lucy: No! I won't promise you that because you have to raise 
your son. Every scraped elbow and every little bedtime story and every time the 
tooth fairy has to visit, that's your job! You are going to raise your son!
[Ian groans]
Ian: I got to go see Eve.

Lucy: No, it's not time! No, it's not -- it's not time. You have 
many years until you see eve. Do you know how mad eve is going to be if you 
leave your son, especially if you leave him with me? She'll never forgive you. 
Please, Ian.
Ian: You're a wonderful mother. You're a wonderful woman.

Lucy: No, Ian, you're my -- my best friend in the whole world! 
Ian Thornhart, I love you and you cannot die on me!
Ian: I'm so cold right now.

Lucy: Oh, they're here. Oh, my God, Ian, help's here. Tess, give 
me your hand! I want you to put your hand right there and keep that pressure on. 
I'm going to make sure that Jack finds them.
[Siren approaches]
Lucy: He's over here! Hurry, he's this way!
Jack: There's blood everywhere, Frank! Come on!
Lucy: He was stabbed in the chest! He -- he --

Frank: Excuse me, Tess. Excuse me, Tess. Having a tough night, 
buddy? There's a lot of blood.

Lucy: I -- I know. I know. Oh, my God. Tell me this isn't 
happening, Jack. Tell me this isn't happening.
Jack: It's going to be ok, it's going to be ok.
Frank: You know, this isn't nearly as deep as it looks.
Jack: What?
Lucy: What?
Frank: Ian? Ian, can you hear me? Can you breathe? You're ok.
Lucy: Wh--
Frank: He's -- he's going to be fine.

Alison: Rafe, listen to me, please? I could not bear the thought 
of losing you again. Do you understand?
Rafe: No, no, no, you're not going to, not ever.

Alison: I just want to help you if I can, ok, so -- so just let 
me, please? Is it the two Livvie’s thing? Is that it?

Rafe: I don't know, it's -- it's just that, see, every time -- 
every time i feel a fight coming on, my slayer instinct gets all up on edge.
Alison: Mm-hmm.

Rafe: I can sense whatever it is I'm about to face. See, that's 
what protects me. But now it's like there's this velvet curtain surrounding 
whatever it is that's giving off this weird vibe, and I just wish that I could 
separate the curtain just for a second so I could reveal whoever or whatever it 
is.
Alison: And this has never happened before?
Rafe: No, never.

Alison: Well, maybe it's -- maybe it's something totally 
different, you know? I mean, you said that this just started happening since you 
came back to earth, so maybe it's something else that you're tapping into, maybe 
something completely different.
Rafe: Like?
Alison: I don't know.
Rafe: Wow. Look at you.
Alison: What?

Rafe: Everything you're going through, and I got your head 
spinning over something that I can't even put into words.
Alison: No, stop it. It's ok, Rafe. It's ok.

Rafe: No, no, no, it's not. You're dealing with losing your 
father.

Alison: And gaining a mother, which I'm really not sure which 
one is worse.

Rafe: Well, whichever, I have no business adding more trouble to 
the mix.

Alison: I just don't know how to help you, and I want to, but I 
don't know how.

Rafe: Well, you know what? I know how. First I'm going to take a 
deep breath. And then I’m going to stop driving us both crazy. I'm just going to 
just shake it all out --
Alison: Oh, my God.

Rafe: Get rid of it all, and then you and me, we're going to 
start living a normal life, all right? Don't let me forget that -- a normal 
life, ok?
Alison: I won't, I promise. When do we start?
Rafe: Well, we're going to start tomorrow.
Alison: Tomorrow?

Rafe: With you. And we're going to get you a -- oh, let me see 
-- a manicure.
Alison: And a pedicure.
Rafe: Oh, absolutely.
Alison: Because they go together.
Rafe: Yeah.
Alison: And you'll get one, too.
Rafe: Absolutely.
Alison: Because I know men like them.

Rafe: Absolutely. Yeah. I really need to start taking better 
care of myself. You know, I -- I got to go work off some of these bad vibes, 
this bad energy. It's driving me nuts.
Alison: Tonight?
Rafe: No, no. No, not tonight. I can't leave you alone tonight.
Alison: Well, Rafe, it's actually ok. I mean --
Rafe: No, it's a bad idea, ok?
Alison: No, no, if you --
Rafe: I'm staying with you.

Alison: No, don't be silly. Stop it. Come on, I’m serious. 
You'll be fine.
Rafe: Alison, I --

Alison: No, Rafe, listen, if you really, really need to work out 
these demons, then why don't you go and work on them, ok? When I come home 
tonight, I promise I will rub some magic right back into you. I promise.
Rafe: Ok. No, I can't, I can't. I can't leave you alone.

Alison: But why? There's millions of people in there. Doree's in 
there. I'll get a ride home with Doree. I promise, ok? Everything -- 
everything's going to be ok.
Rafe: Right.
Alison: Ok?
Rafe: All right. Yeah. I feel better already.
[Elizabeth moans]
Elizabeth: Oh. Oh, that -- that was so amazing. It was just --
oh, it was just amazing.
Stephen: Amazing.

Elizabeth: I can breathe, I can taste. Mmm. I can smell. This is 
like waking up from the dead. Do you know what I mean?
Stephen: I think I do.
Elizabeth: Mmm. Oh, who are you?
Stephen: Does it really matter?

Elizabeth: Well, you have seen into my soul. I don't even know 
your name.
Stephen: I know your name.
Elizabeth: You do?
Stephen: Beauty. Passion. Pain.
Elizabeth: You can see that?

Stephen: From the first moment I laid eyes on you. And it made 
me sad.

Elizabeth: God, if only you knew. My -- my husband recently 
passed away.
Stephen: I'm sorry.

Elizabeth: Oh, no. No. The pain? The pain was here when he was 
alive.
Stephen: Did you love him?

Elizabeth: Hmm, I loved him. I loved him so much. I gave him 
everything I had. I gave him myself. I gave him my little baby girl. I gave him 
everything. And it was never enough. I was always this short of pleasing him. I 
just -- I could never be happy.
Stephen: Hey. So now it's your turn.

Elizabeth: Mmm. Oh, yeah, you would think so. That bastard got 
the final word. All those years of just sucking the life out of me, he just 
dealt me one last slap in the face. He cut me out of his will. He gave 
everything we had to my daughter and to an illegitimate child, which, of course, 
I knew nothing about. So not only did he steal all those years of my life, my 
relationship with my daughter, my self-esteem, he really took my security.
Stephen: How does your daughter feel about that?

Elizabeth: Hmm. I -- I've been trying so hard to build a 
relationship with Alison. I've explained to her that sometimes you have to make 
hard choices, that -- that I have made mistakes, that doing the best that I can, 
but she just -- she won't let me in. She won't even try.
Stephen: You just got to give her time.

Elizabeth: I just have a feeling it's just going to get worse. 
We came so close to making a really great connection, but then -- I don't know, 
I think that Rafe is threatened by me. I think that he doesn't want her to be 
with me.
Stephen: Rafe?

Elizabeth: Yeah, Rafe Kovich, Alison’s fiancée. What? Do you 
know him?
Stephen: As a matter of fact, I think I do.
Ian: I told you I’m fine.

Lucy: Hey, you know what, if frank says you are going in to be 
checked out, then you're going in to be checked out, ok? Ok. He's really all 
right, right? He's all right?
Frank: When I saw all that blood, I was worried, but --
Lucy: I know.
Frank: I'm just glad I was wrong.
Lucy: I know. Thanks.
Jack: Hey. Tess. What -- what happened there?
Tess: Ian is a good man.
Frank: You're not only lucky, you're strong as an ox.
Ian: According to Lucy, it's more like a mule.

Lucy: I think it's about time you did start listening to me, you 
know.
Jack: Hey, get better, man.
Ian: Yeah.
Jack: Hey, it's going to be ok.
Lucy: I know, I know, I know.
Tess: All fixed.

Ian: All fixed. I don't know you did it, but you healed me. It 
was you, wasn't it?
[Music plays]
[chanting]

Livvie: I swear, it felt so much like him. No. Come on, Livvie, 
it wasn't Caleb. He's dead, gone. I made sure of that a long time ago. Just 
focus. Focus, Livvie. Please just stay focused on this Tess creature. Who is she 
and where did she really come from? How am I supposed to make sense of any of 
this if I -- if I can't even figure it out myself? Wait a minute. I do know 
somebody who can help me figure it out.

Livvie: Yes. Hi, my name is Livvie Locke. My father is a patient 
of yours -- Dr. Kevin Collins? Yeah, I just wanted to let you know that I'm 
going to be on the next flight out of the Port Charles Municipal Airport. Yeah, 
I know he's not allowed visitors. That's why I’m calling you right now. Listen, 
I'm his daughter and this is a matter of life and death. I need to speak to him, 
so I will see him.
Elizabeth: You know Alison’s fiancée?

Stephen: Yeah, I think I met him tonight at the party. Rafe is 
such an unusual name.
Elizabeth: Then you probably met Alison, too.

Stephen: I met so many people. This -- this guy Rafe -- I take 
it you're not a fan?

Elizabeth: Oh, he's just poisoning Alison against me. Why is it 
that men -- some men -- feel the need to have this power over women?

Stephen: Some men see beauty in vulnerability and they do 
everything they can to destroy it.

Elizabeth: You really do get it, don't you? Hmm, what am i going 
to do? Oh, Malcolm didn't leave me with anything, and I don't even know how to 
take care of myself anymore.

Stephen: You know, I don't like to speak ill of the recently 
deceased, but your husband was an idiot.
[Knock on door]
[knock]
Elizabeth: Go away.
Alison: I'm not going anywhere, mother!
Elizabeth: God, it's her. It's Alison.
Stephen: Really?

>> On the next "port Charles" --

Reese: The only reason you're in this band is because of

Alison: You have a man in here, don't you?
Rafe: Something's off. Just --
